defs: = ಕುಶಾಲುತೋಪು.
a flat, coarse fabric made of woven or plaited hemp, straw, long blades of grass Desmostachya bipinnata, etc.
the bad governance of a state.
a religious code that is not in conformity with the welfare of the people.
a blade of the grass Desmostachya bipinnata used as an arrow, invoking special power in to it.
iron that is shaped by hammering or beating while it is hot.
the share or cutting blade of a plough; a plough-share.
joy; delight; entertainment; amusement.
the share or cutting blade of a plough; a plough-share.

the Vedic sage Viśvāmitra.

any of a number of large, strong, flesh-eating accipitrine birds of prey noted for their sharp vision and powerful wings; an eagle.
a kitchen-assistant.

bad behaviour; wrong deportment; corrupt practice.
a man of bad behaviour, demeanour; he who indulges in unlawful sexual activity.
a writer or poet who writes formally praising another; a panegyrist.
an actor; a dancer.
an unchaste woman.
a storehouse for threshed grain; a granary.
a grain stored in a granary.
a man who has grains stored in a granary or granaries.
the grass Desmostachya bipinnata ( = Poa cynosuroides) of Poaceae family, with long blades, used in performing religious rites.
another grass of the same family, Desmostachya tripinnata.
a plank used as a lid to cover something.
a piece of wood.
a long narrow strap with each end attached to the bit, used to guide or check a horse etc. in riding or driving; rein.
anything that is, grows or lives in water, as a water-lily, lotus plant etc.
Viṣṇu, whose couch is on water.
Brahma, who was from the lotus flower.
Viṣṇu or Křṣna who has beautiful eye resembling the lotus flower or its petal.

Manmatha, who has lotus flower as one of his five arrows.
unpleasing or repulsive to see; aesthetically offensive; unattractive; ugly.
the quality or state of being ugly; ugliness; unsightliness.
a man whose (spiritual) knowledge is defective.
the tree Diospyros peregrina ( = D. embryopteris, = D. glutenifera) of Ebenaceae family; Indian persimmon.
the sun.
fire.
an ape; a monkey.
joy; delight; entertainment; amusement.

the creeper Pergularia daemia ( = P. extensa, = Daemia extensa) of Asclepiadaceae family.
a kind of worm that eats away the wood and wood articles and renders them strengthless.
(fig.) that which has become useless or trifle.
(wood, a wooden article etc.) to be eaten away by worms, to lose strength and become useless.

a progressive infectious disease caused by the bacterium Mycobacterium leprae that attacks the skin, flesh, nerves, etc., characterised by nodules, ulcers, white scaly scabs, deformities, and the eventual loss of sensation, and is apparently communicated only after long and close contact; leprosy.
a person suffering from leprosy; a leper.
the plant Costus speciosus of Zingiberaeae family.
its starchy root; elephant arrow root.
the vine Trichosanthes dioca of Cucurbitaceae family.
its gourd; wild snake gourd.

the ficus tree Ficus hispida ( = F. oppositifolia) of Moraceae family.
the plant Vernonia anthelminthica.
to contract leprosy.
a person having leprosy; a leper.
the lower part of the alimentary canal, extending from the stomach to the anus and consisting of the small intestine and the large intestine; the intestines.
the vine Cucurbita moschata of Cucurbitaceae family.
its gourd; sweet gourd.
another vine of the same family Cucurbita maxima.
its gourd.
the vine Beninesa hispida ( = B. cerifera) of the same family.
its gourd; white gourd melon.

an association with bad, wicked persons; bad company.
a narrow place; narrowness.
(astrol.) a conjunction of stars or planets that augurs evil to happen.

the tree Diospyros peregrina ( = D. embryopteris, = D. glutenifera) of Ebenaceae family; Indian persimmon.

skill - a) great ability or proficiency; expertness that comes from training, practice, etc.; b) an art, craft or science, esp. one involving the use of the hands or body; c) ability in such an art, craft or science.

ಕುಳವಾರು ಇಲ್ಲದೆ ಊರಿಗೆ ತಳವಾರ ಏನು ಮಾಡಿಯಾನು? kuḷavāru illada ūrige taḷavāra ēnu māḍiyānu? (prov.) whoever be the incumbent in a government office, nothing can be done without proper records; ತಳವಾರನಿಗೆ ಪಟ್ಟಾ ಕಟ್ಟಿದರೆ ಕುಳವಾರು ಹೋದೀತೇ? taḷavāranige paṭṭā kaṭṭidare kuḷavāru hōdītē? (prov.) no one would lose, in general, title to his property whoever holds the reins of administration.
